TopicTitle: Am I the only one that does not understand how to add mods in .20?

Articles.Content: I honestly do not understand it at all.
haven't even tried to figure em out yet, none of the ones I use are updated yet anyway.
They seem to work if installed the old way, but I'm sure there's a better method. I haven't been able to figure that out either, so for now you can just do it the same way as before...

the 0.20 method involves using the GameData folder, each mod can have its own folder in there to make adding/removing mods simpler. When you download a .20 compliant mod you should get a gamedata folder. The contents of that go in your ksp gamedata folder and you're ready to go.

Hope that helps.

Edited May 24, 2013 by smarky55
grammar
so just extract it into gamedata and that's it? to easy is gotta be a trap.

You know that now-empty parts folder that originally had every part in it? Put your mod parts there, making sure the .cfg text is wrapped in:

PART

{

...

}

As for internals and plugins, same deal. Put each in the appropriate (and now-empty) internals and plugins folders. Internals folder will need separate props and spaces folders as none exist on a fresh download.

Hope this helped

Much better.....

Edited June 6, 2013 by dr_jt
I have each of my mod parts wrapped in those extra brackets and they work fine, so I'd suggest ensuring that your mod parts are wrapped in brackets
